 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ADAPTABLE
INFO AND RELATIONSHIPS(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be
programmatically determined or are available in text. 

These websites...

Create content that can be presented in different ways (for example simpler
layout) without losing information or structure.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 A form with required fields 

A form contains several required fields. The labels for the required fields are
displayed in red. In addition, at the end of each label is an asterisk
character, *. The instructions for completing the form indicate that "all
required fields are displayed in red and marked with an asterisk *", followed by
an example. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/info-and-relationships.html#examples]
 Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
